channel.title: Installing a game on an external HDD
channel.description:
I recently bought an external hdd case and a hdd.
It has the following specs: 1 TB, divided over 2 partitions (if that matters) 7200 rpm 32 mb cache USB 2.0 connection
My laptops internal hdd is full, so I was wondering if I could install games on my external without performance loss?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Installing a game on an external HDD
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Correct me if i’m wrong but you will barely feel a performance loss, except for when your loading map data into ram.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing a game on an external HDD

item.title: Installing a game on an external HDD
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t have a firewire port on my laptop that’s faster then USB 2.0. I tried playing Napoleons campaigns, and I didn’t notice anything. But that can be because of the low requirements the game has. I’ll try SWAT 4 next. Oh wait, that ain’t a great game to test it.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing a game on an external HDD

item.title: Installing a game on an external HDD
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:1, topic:249145”]I recently bought an external hdd case and a hdd.

It has the following specs:
1 TB, divided over 2 partitions (if that matters)
7200 rpm
32 mb cache
USB 2.0 connection

My laptops internal hdd is full, so I was wondering if I could install games on my external without performance loss?

Thanks in advance.[/quote]You will feel a small performance loss since it isn’t as fast as your internal disks (due to USB 2.0 connection)

Read full topic
